eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: Fashion Street residents' opinions on the whole relocation business gradually soften, and one of them gives Costa a gift. Keller comes to the one-night-reopened Mockingbird Café and reminiscences with Costa, while Eyjafjalla, witnessed by Dolly, finds the answer to the 'seed.'

attributes.content: Huff...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Why are you still here?
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I'm going to be scuttling around here like a four-legged Metal Crab on the beach until I can get all your signatures.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Fine, scuttle on then. I'm packing up, going home and having a drink.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Be my guest.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I bought this new gadget at the market today, this 'Originium Microwave Massager' something or other. Columbian thing. Can't make sense of it, but it works wonders. Feels like real relief sticking it on my back.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: It's not bad trying something new.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Was that shaggy beckbeast riding a surfboard on the roof one of your funnies too?
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Shaggy beckbeast? No, that's not...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Shame about that, I liked it. Entertainment that good has been rare ever since we lost the Obsidian Festival.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I'm glad it made you happy...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Right, got something for you.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: ...A kalimba?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Did you pick this up from the same market?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Congrats on the marriage, sonny.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: You got a safe job for your family. A boring one, but you've got a sense of responsibility.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I can understand you like stability, but life's full of ways. Don't live out the hound days, son.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Each day lived is a hound day... you just have to roll with the punches.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I used to gamble with your grandpa, if you'll remember. We said you'd always come back from Obsidian with the grand prize one day.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Honestly... what a waste of all that musical talent.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: If you're interested, I can still bring my guitar out sometime. Play it for you again.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: If you'd played us a number on that thing sooner, your letter might've been the first to have my signature on it.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Mrs. Harley, we recovered the surfboards that went missing here. Can you check if that's all of them?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I'm so sorry about this...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You helped me here. What are you apologizing for?
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I didn't think these old things would ever get used again. It's funny—just who would've taken them?
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Oh, well, I'm not too sure either...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: That's alright, girl. It could be some tourists just picked them up while they were having too much fun—no harm, no foul. How are you? Did you have fun today?
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: You mean getting drenched in hot spring water?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Didn't it bring back a little of that seaside fun? It hasn't been so lively in forever—even the customers here to drink were all smiles.
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Those owners were always frowning day in and day out. Even the drink was starting to taste bad...
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Harley looks towards the tourists outside who still haven't scattered. Sunset gradually dyes the sky. Every single person's feeling merry.
It's like we've gone back years and years.
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: A man listlessly heads for the old cafe, and pushes open its door once again.

He feels for the light switch. Carefully, he uses a rag to wipe the dust from the counter, then pulls the equipment out from the cupboards, before pulling a pouch out of his chest pocket. Fresh coffee beans, brought back from the office.
Like so many years ago, he boils, he grinds, then attentively, he pours.
Huff...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Flavor is... I guess I've gotten rusty.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: He looks out of the window. One after another, people make their way home while it's still dusk. The street grows gradually more desolate, until there's no one out at all. Only then does he chuckle to himself, bitterly.
Seriously... what the hell am I waiting for?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: He finishes his coffee, and prepares to tidy everything away and get out of here.
A knock comes from the door. Costa remembers he never even shut it.
Who is it?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Good evening...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Are you still open?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, you promise you've made it clear to the Little Black Sheep? Not to cause trouble like this anymore?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Yep... any more mess, and I'll disavow them as my clones.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: (Tumbles about in the air)
attributes.name: Dozy Creature

attributes.content: (Headbutts walls in the street)
attributes.name: Agitated Creature

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Fine, I'll try as hard as I can...
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: (Attempts to walk calmly)
attributes.name: Dozy Creature

attributes.content: See? Much better.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: But they still caused plenty of chaos at the trade fair today...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: But the air was full of the smell of joy, you mean. Mmm, it's sugary sweet even now. It's just like the first time I took a walk across the 'countries' you talk about.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Where there's hilly areas, you can glide. Where there's watery areas, you can surf. I even had a couple of bastard annoying animals chasing me all over the wilds. Every place produces something different.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Knowing how your human race can't just tour the whole place, getting to see such interesting things must be novel for you, right?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Why do I get the sense you're showing off, Mr. Dolly?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Busted.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Did you have fun today then, Adele? Hot springs let you relax, skateboarding's a thrill, and that loud-ass penguin's loud-ass music got you pumped up, didn't it?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, those children could see the lambs!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: *sigh* How is it this hard to cheer you up? There's that 'brooding' flavor in the air again, bitter and tart!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Adele turns away to hide a little giggle, then recovers her straight face.
Mr. Dolly, we're here. I need to leave the owner a note saying we've found the exhibit, and thank you for worrying about us.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I have the pen and paper in my bag...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Oh, is this cafe... open again?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Dim yellow lights perfuse the interior. Through the windows, the cafe's furnishings can vaguely be made out.
Costa pours hot water, the sound breaking the silence between him and his customer.
Condensation fills the windows. Adele gently wipes the hot springs' white mist from the glass, and finally catches a proper glimpse of the customer.
What did we stop for? Aren't we going in for coffee?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: ...Professor Keller?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I got The Atlas of Terra's Volcanoes. I never thought you'd have kept it safe for so many years... Thank you.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Ah, I asked a little lady. She came here looking for some exhibit. Just so happened to be the Volcano Museum's.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Is, um, she your employee?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Adele is my student.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Ah, your student. Right, right...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: You've been...
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: ...quite the miserable worker at city hall lately. Gathering signatures for an LOI to relocate the residents...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: My parents left their own little clothing shop. Reasonably speaking, I should need to sign too.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Do you... have any objections to the redevelopment, then?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Our family stopped leaning on this place for our livelihood long ago. If it would make your work go any smoother...?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Of course, and thank you for your cooperation...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Want another cup?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Can that come with the old complimentary chat, then?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: As a qualified barista, listening is part of my work.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Take a seat, then.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Maybe we should go, Mr. Dolly? Today doesn't seem like the right one to leave a message.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Aww, but the coffee smells so good. Can't we have some...?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: (Prepares to charge headlong into the cafe)
attributes.name: Agitated Creature

attributes.content: Hey... hey!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The closed glass door blocks the lamb's strike, and it hardly makes as loud a noise as she expected. It simply turns tail and shoots back into the street, where it tumbles around.
Adele nervously observes how the two inside react.
Why did you up and leave when you did?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I met two... very interesting people.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: When you study volcanoes, you're always visiting new places.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I remember. You met each other in here a lot.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Mm. And if they came, you'd plug your guitar in, and off you went with your heavy metal racket.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Magna always felt 'that boy at the cafe' never seemed to welcome them too much.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Aah... I was just a little too willful of a brat, back then.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It wasn't meant at them specifically...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I know. And they didn't take it to heart.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: You gave them coffee soda to try once, and make us swear to secrecy that we wouldn't tell Grandpa Mockingbird.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: He couldn't stand the drinks I came up with. Every time I added them to the menu, he'd wipe them off... They were just as bizarre to him as my axe, and my drumkit.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: By the way, that wasn't just your average coffee soda. It was called 'volcanic coffee.'
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Alright, alright, yes, 'volcanic coffee.'
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: It was a nice drink, in any case. After we went to Leithanien, Katia would follow your recipe to recreate the flavor for himself.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: How are... Katia, and... Magna doing?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I remember when you left Siesta, you said, you'd be visiting every volcano across the land with them.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I spent a long, long time with them on our travels.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: But a few years ago, we strayed apart.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Strayed?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: And we're never to meet again.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Was it...? I'm so sorry...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Hence why I came back. Opened that museum. Hoped I could preserve all the research they'd done.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: When I—saw you at the museum that day, it completely... totally blindsided me.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It was a great surprise to me too. You're nothing like the noisy little child I remember.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: You, too... You're a museum curator and everything.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Mm. I suppose I've turned an old ideal or two into reality. No matter what, though, the conviction that keeps me going now isn't... really what drove me in the first place anymore.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Still, change isn't always a bad thing, wouldn't you say?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: The two lapse into silence for a while. The customer lightly stirs at the coffee in her cup.
Did you go to the trade fair today?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: The trade fair? I did. Tourists were profuse, proprietors were in high spirits—much like the Siesta of old.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Maybe once this place is all rebuilt, and the tourist influx comes, I'll have an idea or two about what's next for me.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: For example?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Who knows...? I'll probably keep running a cafe, but maybe a rock 'n' roll cafe, or just a music shop, filled to the walls with drum kits and guitars. Lots to try. Always someone out there who'll enjoy it.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Just like you say... just like the Siesta of old.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Oh, something very funny that happened today too. I was at the trade fair, and I saw this soft drink from Columbia. The recipe was one-for-one with my 'volcanic coffee.' The exact same.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Well, I didn't leak your secret recipe!
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: No, no, it was a year ago when I was planning to shutter the shop. I told somebody else about how to make it.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: But honestly... it's just coffee plus soda water. Of course some Columbian could've come up with it on their own too.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Hand-brewed coffee and soda water. How did you come up with it at first?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: When I was young, I thought coffee was so bitter, I was convinced I had to add something to even make it drinkable!
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: You shook the whole cafe playing your rock 'n' roll, and yet you were bad with bitter.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Who'd care about something like that, back then?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Keller laughs, downing the last gulp of coffee in her cup. The aroma lingers lazily in the cafe air.
So, want soda in this cup too?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: But after this one, I may well genuinely spend the whole night awake.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Adele, let me just be upfront. I told them what I told them, but the lot of them are dying to go inside, probably to taste the volcanic coffee.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: To make up for the owner's losses, I can leave a product from today's trade fair in exchange!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: A product from the fair? Where'd you get it?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: A lovely little child gave me it!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Honest!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Ah! We can't go in now!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: (Sniffs in corner)
attributes.name: Agitated Creature

attributes.content: (Turns over a box)
attributes.name: Dozy Creature

attributes.content: The restless lambs drag a case of glass bottles out from the junk to Adele's side, and zealously churn through it for something.
Eventually, they get a few bottles of carbonated water clamped in their mouths and pull off the metal caps, acting like they've found treasure.
What are you doing? Didn't you want to a soda?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The lambs bounce about, each one with a shiny bottle cap on their head. Then they line up together, and playfully scamper away.
*sigh* I said to wait. What makes them even more impatient than me?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: What was all that...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Oh, that's the 'seed' they were after!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: What about these bottle caps... makes them seeds?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The world as they see it isn't quite the world you all see.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: This—itty-bitty little round thing—gets taken by fowlbeasts to places far far away, where it takes root and sprouts, and becomes something completely unlike before.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Some become soda caps, some become sauce lids, each one has a different flavor, but they all have their own charms.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: I assume at least one of them drank that sort of volcanic coffee in Columbia before, so this rings that bell in them particularly loud.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Isn't it more than fascinating to view the world that way?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: (Digs at the soil)
attributes.name: Left-Behind Creature

attributes.content: But all that granted... *sigh* Just because you planted the bottle caps doesn't mean they're going to grow into drinks.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Let them have their fun.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: The answers will grow by themselves.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Hello, Costa here.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Mr. Costa, this is your grandfather's clinician. I'm sorry to tell you this, but... your grandfather passed away this evening.
attributes.name: Voice on the Phone

attributes.content: I can't know if this will be any comfort to you, but I want you to know he left us peacefully.
attributes.name: Voice on the Phone
